intro: Ptarmica, commonly known as mountain sorrel, is a flowering plant belonging to the genus Potentilla. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils. Ptarmica has lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges, and it produces edible leaves that have a tangy, sour flavor. It is often used in herbal remedies and as a ornamental plant in gardens.
